newsitem.title: TANZANIA: Skanska to develop Tanzania gold mine.
newsitem.headline: Skanska to develop Tanzania gold mine.

text.p: Swedish company Skanska International signed on Thursday an $11.4 million deal for the first phase of underground mine development at a gold mine operated by a subsidiary of Sutton Resources in northwest Tanzania.
The signing by Skanska and Sutton executives in the presence of Swedish Ambassador in Tanzania Thomas Palme was on the sidelines of an international investor forum in Tanzania.

"The underground work will be finished by 1998. Mining construction will be accomplished by mid-1999 and the first gold will be produced in late 1999," said Sutton executive Michael Kenyon. Sutton is the parent company of Kahama Mining Corp, operators of the gold mine at Bulyanhulu.

Kenyon estimated gold production at the facility at 200,000 ounces or more per year. Preliminary exploration had shown that the mine had reserves of 3.5 million ounces at a grade of 15 grammes to a tonne, a company official told Reuters.
